intro: Secamone retusa, commonly known as the smooth secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers, which are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
